alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 20 at 12:42PM MST until December 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 to 6 inches at lower elevations below 5000 feet, and up to 12 inches at or above mountain passes. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills will be coldest Wednesday night through early Thursday afternoon.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
